title: Why So Many People Get Financial Advice That Is Wrong for Them
summary: Advisers too often assume all people have somewhat similar preferences. The result is that outliers—and there are a lot of them—get investments that don’t fit their needs.

fullContent: Mahendra Singh Dhoni has partnered with Acko, the D2C insurer, as both an investor and brand ambassador, signaling his confidence in the company's mission. Dhoni's investment, made through his family office, reflects a shared vision for simplifying insurance for the modern Indian consumer. Acko aims to redefine insurance through technology and customer-centricity.

title: Without Federal Funding, Antibiotics Research May Lag
summary: Several experts told Undark that federal funds play a critical role in antibiotic discovery. One reason: The drugs are not typically profitable — in part because most people only need them for a short period of time.
fullContent: Several experts told Undark that federal funds play a critical role in antibiotic discovery. One reason: The drugs are not typically profitable — in part because most people only need them for a short period of time. Because antibiotics don’t make much money, the pharmaceutical industry doesn’t focus on them.

title: India's targeted capital liberalisation, RBI's FX strategy shield economy from global shocks: Report
summary: India's cautious approach to opening its capital account, coupled with the RBI's strategic foreign exchange management, has shielded the economy from global shocks. A Motilal Oswal report highlights India's strengthened external sector, marked by a low current account deficit,...
fullContent: India's cautious approach to opening its capital account, coupled with the RBI's strategic foreign exchange management, has shielded the economy from global shocks. A Motilal Oswal report highlights India's strengthened external sector, marked by a low current account deficit, record-high foreign exchange reserves, and a shift towards high-value service exports.

title: Real estate sentiment rebounds as stakeholders place confidence on macro stability
summary: India's real estate sector is recovering after a subdued period. Improved macroeconomic conditions and easing liquidity are supporting investment decisions. Sentiment scores are rising, reflecting confidence in the medium-term outlook.
fullContent: India's real estate sector is recovering after a subdued period. Improved macroeconomic conditions and easing liquidity are supporting investment decisions. Sentiment scores are rising, reflecting confidence in the medium-term outlook. Office leasing and premium housing demand are driving the recovery. Key markets like Bengaluru, Hyderabad, Mumbai, and Pune are leading the rebound.
